model_input:
Your task is to choose a more helpful MEMORY based on the below criterion.

CRITERION:
Helpfulness - The MEMORY should contain information that is both useful and relevant, enabling the Speaker A to respond in an appropriate context to the last utterance of the DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

The output format should be as follows:
Explanation: (a brief explanation)
Choice: (answer with "1", "2", or "tie")

Now choose the MEMORY that has better Helpfulness.

DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Okay, so, I watched Pulp Fiction, and I loved it! Thank you for the recommendation.
Speaker B: Of course. I recommend that movie to everyone I meet. I think I've watched it over one hundred times. So what is the next movie on your list to watch soon?
Speaker A: Yeah it was great and I will also recommend to people when they ask what movie is good. So next is another one you recommended which is coming to America. Whatâ€™s the next movie your going to watch? 
Speaker B: There is a horror genre movie that was released just this week which I'm going to watch tonight. It is called "Girl Next."
Speaker A: Oh that sounds interesting, I will look into that and put it on my list. How has your job been going? Is there where you get all these great ideas for what to watch?  
Speaker B: My Film Studies professor job has been going absolutely great lately. I love all my students, because they really get into the lectures and ask lots of questions. Yes, my job requires me to watch movies all the time, so that is how I find the best ones. Is your programmer job going all right lately? 

MEMORY 1:
Speaker B enjoys watching a variety of movie genres with their kids and provides recommendations based on Speaker A's preferences. Speaker B used to teach Film Studies and now carefully chooses what movies to watch. Speaker A is interested in watching movies, mentioned Pulp Fiction, and Uma Thurman. Speaker B's sister shares the same opinion about age as Speaker A and they both used to teach Film Studies. Speaker A was disappointed with the movie "Showtime" starring Eddie Murphy and DeNiro.

MEMORY 2:
User Description: Speaker B is a 40-year-old former Film Studies teacher who enjoys teaching, reading, playing music, watching movies, and hiking. They like suspense films, action, SF, horror, westerns, drama, and an occasional good comedy. Speaker B is concerned about the grizzly population in Alaska and has a good relationship with their kids, allowing them to watch Disney, Pixar, and older films.

Relationship Description: Speaker B and Speaker A have an engaging and friendly relationship, with Speaker A relying on Speaker B for movie suggestions. Speaker B encourages Speaker A to watch specific movies and offers recommendations based on their preferences.

Event Description: Speaker B and Speaker A discuss movie preferences, with Speaker B recommending movies such as Pulp Fiction, Coming to America, Coming 2 America, and I-SPY, all featuring Eddie Murphy. Speaker A expresses interest in unique movies and relies on Speaker B for suggestions, leading to a conversation about various film genres and actors.

YOUR OUTPUT:
prediction:
Explanation: The goal is to determine which MEMORY provides more relevant and useful information that Speaker A can use to respond to Speaker B's last utterance about how Speaker B's Film Studies professor job has been going great. MEMORY 2 explicitly describes Speaker B's background as a former Film Studies teacher, their movie preferences, and their relationship dynamics with Speaker A, which aligns well with the ongoing conversation about movie recommendations and Speaker B's professional life. MEMORY 1 provides some overlapping information, but it is not as coherent or detailed in directly supporting the current context of the discussion.

Choice: 2
